dcterms:creator: R.B. Platte
L.N Trefethen
A.B.J. Kuijlaars
dcterms:description: Runge's function is a well-known benchmark function used to illustrate the Runge phenomenon, where polynomial interpolation on equispaced points diverges while interpolation based on Chebychev nodes results in geometrical convergence.
dcterms:title: Runge's function

dcterms:creator: T. A. Driscoll
N. Hale
L. N. Trefethen
dcterms:description: Chebychev nodes are specific points used in polynomial interpolation that help to minimize the Runge phenomenon and improve convergence rates.
dcterms:title: Chebychev nodes

dcterms:creator: L. N. Trefethen
dcterms:description: Polynomial interpolation is a method of estimating values between known data points using polynomials, which can exhibit poor behavior when applied to certain functions.
dcterms:title: Polynomial interpolation

dcterms:creator: L. N. Trefethen
dcterms:description: Various analytic functions such as cos(20x) and |sin 5x|^3 are used to test the performance of interpolation methods and the behavior of approximation techniques.
dcterms:title: Various analytic functions (e.g., cos(20x), |sin 5x|^3, etc.)

dcterms:creator: L. N. Trefethen
dcterms:description: Functions with lower regularities are used to evaluate the performance of interpolation methods and their stability under various conditions.
dcterms:title: Functions with lower regularities
